title: How to Build a Daily Supplement Stack
excerpt: A practical framework to choose your foundation and add-ons without overbuying.
content: Start with a clear goal: daily energy, recovery, sleep, gut support, or all-around health.
Build your foundation first. A multivitamin, omega-3, and vitamin D/K2 often cover the broadest nutritional gaps.
Add targeted support only after your base is consistent for 2-4 weeks.
Keep your stack simple enough to sustain daily. Consistency beats complexity.

title: Men's Core Essentials Stack: What to Include
excerpt: The core nutrients and add-ons that make sense for most men.
content: A men's foundation stack should prioritize broad micronutrients and omega-3 support.
Add performance-focused options like creatine if training is a priority.
For stress and recovery, magnesium glycinate is one of the most practical additions.

title: Women's Core Essentials Stack: What to Include
excerpt: A clear, practical foundation with room for skin, gut, and recovery support.
content: A women's foundation stack often starts with a quality multivitamin and omega-3.
Collagen and probiotics are common targeted add-ons based on skin and gut goals.
Choose stack options that match your day-to-day routine to improve adherence.

title: How to Read a Supplement Label with Confidence
excerpt: What to check first on dosage, forms, and quality signals.
content: Check active ingredient forms, not just names.
Compare serving size and dose to clinically studied ranges.
Look for third-party testing and clear, transparent labeling.
